page.title: 20Tockwith Charity Cycle Race.
page.content: The first cycle race was organized in June 1982, by a Tockwith youth leader, Mr Alan Kay. It was to raise money, by sponsorship, for Tockwith Youth Club. The race was from Tockwith to Scarborough, 62 miles away. It was so popular that it has become an annual event. In 1985, the race started in Wetherby. 392 cyclists took part. Their ages ranged from 12 to 80 years. The fastest person took 4 hours, and the slowest 10 hours. People from all over the area took part and people from as far afield as London and Devon. The race was advertised locally and in cycling magazines. Approximately Â£10 500 was raised and the money was shared between Martin House Children's Hospice for the terminally ill, and a National Cancer Relief Fund.
